rev.comment: no distributions use it primarly because that simply is not the point
rev.diff:
Line 24: Line 24:
The main advantage of Zero Install over more popular packaging systems is that no [[Root (computing)|root]] password is needed to install software; packages can be installed in system locations writable by that user. Thus, package installation affects only the user installing it, which makes it possible for all users to be able to install and run new software.
The main advantage of Zero Install over more popular packaging systems is that no [[Root (computing)|root]] password is needed to install software; packages can be installed in system locations writable by that user. Thus, package installation affects only the user installing it, which makes it possible for all users to be able to install and run new software.
â   â
The main disadvantage of Zero Install over more popular packaging systems is that not only is it not popular as a function of the number of users, but there are very few things that are packaged with Zero Install and no usable distributions that use it primarily.
